intro: Sasa nagasei f. pilosa, commonly known as the hairy bamboo, is a variant of the Sasa genus native to Japan. It is characterized by its dense,丛生 (clump-forming) growth habit and stiff, hairy leaves that give it a distinctive appearance. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as mountain forests. Its culms (stems) are strong and hollow, typical of the grass family (Poaceae). This ornamental bamboo is valued for its aesthetic appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
